c: ^I watch Timothy, as he seems to debate with himself to approach us.

^[Charlotte] "I must say, your immediate presence seems much bolder, and more relaxed than I've seen you."

^, you've got my thanks... as well as Timothy's, no doubt."

c: ^"Well, it’s your last day. Plus, I can't be mad you made Timothy that happy, so I'll let it slide."

SadStart: ^I spot Timothy sitting at one of the tables alone.

s0: ^He seems to be in a quiet mood today.
s1: ^He's quiet again. Am I too late to help him?

s0: ^I silently eat with him for a while until I hear a loud voice approach.
s1: ^I search for something to say to break the silence. Anything. But before I find the words, a loud voice approaches.

g-0: ^[Max] "Again? You two really need to sort out your sleep schedules!"

s0: ^... different... from what my life has been these past many years

Breakdown: ^Timothy stays quiet, but Eduardo doesn't seem to notice.

g-0: ^Timothy doesn't respond. I turn to face him.
^He doesn't seem to be looking at anything in particular and he's visibly shaking.
^Timothy looks vaguely in my direction and outstretches his hand.
^His hand clasps onto my arm with the shaky, ironclad grip of desperation. I feel his racing heartbeat through his palm.
^His lips move as if trying to speak, but no words escape them.
^With his free hand he clutches onto his shirt.
^No one seems to hear my weak call over the chatter and laughter.

^I summon up as much confidence as I can muster. I'm able to break the spell long enough to shout.
^I summon up as much confidence as I can muster. I'm able to break the spell long enough to shout.
